Indication: Chickens - As an aid in the prevention of chronic respiratory disease during periods of stress
Limitations: Feed for 2 days before stress and 3 to 6 days after stress. Withdraw 24 hours before slaughter
SpecialConsiderations: (1) Federal law restricts medicated feed containing this veterinary feed directive (VFD) drug to use by or on the order of a licensed veterinarian. See §558.6 for additional requirements. (2) The expiration date of VFDs for erythromycin medicated feeds must not exceed 6 months from the date of issuance. VFDs for erythromycin shall not be refilled

Indication: Chickens - As an aid in the prevention of infectious coryza
Limitations: Feed for 7 to 14 days. Withdraw 24 hours before slaughter
SpecialConsiderations: (1) Federal law restricts medicated feed containing this veterinary feed directive (VFD) drug to use by or on the order of a licensed veterinarian. See §558.6 for additional requirements. (2) The expiration date of VFDs for erythromycin medicated feeds must not exceed 6 months from the date of issuance. VFDs for erythromycin shall not be refilled

Indication: Chickens - As an aid in the prevention and reduction of lesions and in lowering severity of chronic respiratory disease (CRD)
Limitations: Feed for 5 to 8 days. Withdraw 48 hours before slaughter. Do not use in birds producing eggs for food
SpecialConsiderations: (1) Federal law restricts medicated feed containing this veterinary feed directive (VFD) drug to use by or on the order of a licensed veterinarian. See §558.6 for additional requirements. (2) The expiration date of VFDs for erythromycin medicated feeds must not exceed 6 months from the date of issuance. VFDs for erythromycin shall not be refilled
